issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I run the app in a real iPad, when I open the camera in landscape mode I see a black bar on the right side (768px height x 30-50px width, see image attached).

When I rotate the iPad in portrait mode it disappears and camera is ok, but when I rotate back to landscape the black bar comes back.

When I open the camera in portrait mode all seems to be ok..

I also have an overlay view with some labels.
However, this application opens camera for Augmented Reality. 
It works well for iPad and iPhone IF I compile under Titanium 2.1.2 on Titanium SDK 2.0.1.GA2, Xcode 4.3.2.
The issue happens when I switch between 2.0.1.GA2 (Xcode 4.3.2) and 2.1.3.GA(Xcode 4.5.1), no code changes...

it seems to be a Titanium SDK bug
fields.summary: iOS: CameraView: showControls: false on iPAD landscape leaves a black bar across left of screen

comments.body: We'd like a simple test case for this if possible. Cheers.

I've set this to resolved so that the issue can now be edited to provide more info.
Thanks,
Daniel
